oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Hackberry Ramblers Performance - 1999-12-03 - Tape 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The tape is of a performance by the Hackberry Ramblers (musical group). The tape was recorded on December 03, 1999. The tape is part one of two.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Hackberry Ramblers
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Kyle Young expresses his thanks; additionally, Young recognizes the accomplishments of the Hackberry Ramblers -- (03:58) Young introduces the members of the Hackberry Ramblers -- (06:12) Luderin Darbone shows his appreciation while preparing to play; additionally, Darbone tells the story of why he chose to donate his fiddle to the Country Music Hall of Fame -- (15:31) Darbone recalls what had created the damage on his fiddle -- (18:06) Young introduces Edwin Duhon to speak -- (18:28) Duhon presents the guitar he used in his twenties to the Country Music Hall of Fame -- (20:17) Young introduces Rodney Crowell -- (20:44) Crowell congratulates the Hackberry Ramblers and reflects on their influence on his childhood -- (25:47) James "Glen" Crocker introduces -- (25:55) Hackberry Ramblers' Theme Song (Hackberry Ramblers) -- (26:58) Crocker introduces "Turtle Tail" -- (27:08) Turtle Tail (Hackberry Ramblers) -- (29:18) Crocker jokes about a pregnant woman -- (30:02) Jolie Blonde [incomplete] (Hackberry Ramblers)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Hackberry Ramblers;
